clause_text: WHEREAS, pursuant to Article III of the Original Declaration, the Declarant reserved the exclusive and unilateral right to annex any additional property.
plain_summary: The Declarant has the exclusive right to add more property to the existing development as per Article III of the Original Declaration.

clause_text: NOW THEREFORE, pursuant to the powers retained by Declarant as a Class "B" Member under the Declaration, the Declarant hereby annexes the real property as shown on the map or plat thereof recorded in Volume 1102, Page 813 in the Map or Plat Records of Grimes County, Texas (the "Subdivision") into Plantation Lakes.
plain_summary: The Declarant is officially adding the specified real property into the Plantation Lakes development.

clause_text: No Dwelling or other structure shall be erected nearer to any street or property line than that allowed by the applicable plat or other recorded documents, provided that a minimum rear setback equal to twenty-five feet (25') or the rear utility easement as shown on the applicable plat of the Subdivision, whichever is greater, shall be observed on all Lots; and, provided further that a minimum side setback equal to twenty-five foot (25') or the side utility easement as shown on the applicable plat of the Subdivision, whichever is greater, shall be observed on all Lots. Detached garages and driveways shall be permitted to be placed within a setback as approved by the ARC.
plain_summary: Structures must adhere to minimum setback requirements from property lines, with specific measurements for rear and side setbacks, unless otherwise approved by the Architectural Review Committee (ARC).

clause_text: Owners of Lot 1, Block 1 in the Subdivision are hereby advised that there exists a fifty-foot (50') drainage easement on the eastern Lot line of Lot 1, Block 1, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision (the '50' Drainage Easement'). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the 50' Drainage Easement and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain. Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the 50' Drainage Easement, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the 50' Drainage Easement.
plain_summary: Owners of Lot 1, Block 1 must acknowledge a 50-foot drainage easement on their property, releasing the Declarant and Association from liability related to it, and granting them easement rights for incidental effects.

clause_text: Owners hereby acknowledge that the Association, its directors, officers, managers, agents, or employees, the Declarant or any successor Declarant have made no representations or warranties nor has any Owner, occupant, tenant, guest or invitee relied upon any representations or warranties, expressed or implied, relative to water level variances and/or any future change in use of the 50' Drainage Easement. Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the 50' Drainage Easement on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the 50' Drainage Easement.
plain_summary: Owners must maintain the 50-foot drainage easement on their lot without altering its natural state, and they cannot rely on any representations about water level changes or future use.

clause_text: Owners of Lot 8, Block 1 in the Subdivision are hereby advised that there exist several thirty-foot (30') drainage easements along certain Lot lines of Lot 8, Block 1, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision (the '30' Drainage Easements'). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the 30' Drainage Easements and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain. Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the 30' Drainage Easements, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the 30' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners of Lot 8, Block 1 must acknowledge several 30-foot drainage easements on their property, releasing the Declarant and Association from liability related to them, and granting them easement rights for incidental effects.

clause_text: Owners hereby acknowledge that the Association, its directors, officers, managers, agents, or employees, the Declarant or any successor Declarant have made no representations or warranties nor has any Owner, occupant, tenant, guest or invitee relied upon any representations or warranties, expressed or implied, relative to water level variances and/or any future change in use of the 30' Drainage Easements. Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the 30' Drainage Easements on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the 30' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners must maintain the 30-foot drainage easements on their lot without altering their natural state, and they cannot rely on any representations about water level changes or future use.

clause_text: Owners of Lots 7, 8, and 9, in Block I in the Subdivision are hereby advised that there exists a thirty-foot (30') right of way easement granted to Enserch Corp. (more particularly described in Volume 504, Page 783 in the Official Public Records of Waller County) that runs through Lots 7, 8, and 9, in Block I (the "Right of Way"). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the Right of Way and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain. Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the Right of Way, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the Right of Way. Owners hereby acknowledge that the Association, its directors, officers, managers, agents, or employees, the Declarant or any successor Declarant have made no representations or warranties nor has any Owner, occupant, tenant, guest or invitee relied upon any representations or warranties, expressed or implied, relative to any future change in use of the Right of Way. Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the Right of Way on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the Right of Way.
plain_summary: Owners of Lots 7, 8, and 9 must acknowledge a 30-foot right of way easement and agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for its existence. They must maintain the easement and cannot alter it.

clause_text: Owners of Lots 16 and 17, Block 1 in the Subdivision are advised that there exists a forty-foot (40') drainage easement along the western Lot line of Lot 16, Block 1 and on the eastern Lot line of Lot 17, Block 1, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision and owners of Lot 20, Block 1 are advised that there exists a forty foot (40') drainage easement along the northern Lot line of Lot 20, Block 1, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision (collectively, the "40' Drainage Easements"). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the 40' Drainage Easements and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain. Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the 40' Drainage Easements, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the 40' Drainage Easements. Owners hereby acknowledge that the Association, its directors, officers, managers, agents, or employees, the Declarant or any successor Declarant have made no representations or warranties nor has any Owner, occupant, tenant, guest or invitee relied upon any representations or warranties, expressed or implied, relative to water level variances and/or any future change in use of the 40' Drainage Easements. Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the 40' Drainage Easements on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the 40' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners of Lots 16, 17, and 20 must recognize a 40-foot drainage easement and cannot hold the Declarant or Association liable for its existence. They must maintain the easement and cannot alter it.

clause_text: Owners of Lot 22, Block I in the Subdivision are advised that there exists a twenty-five foot (25') drainage easement along the western perimeter of Restricted Reserve B and the eastern Lot line of Lot 22, Block I, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision and Owners of Lot 42, Block I are advised that there exists a twenty-five foot (25') drainage easement on the northern Lot line of Lot 42, Block I, as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision (collectively, the "25' Drainage Easements"). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the 25' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners of Lots 22 and 42 must acknowledge a 25-foot drainage easement and agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for its existence.

clause_text: Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the 25' Drainage Easements, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the 25' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners allow the Declarant and the Association to have an easement for any incidental disturbances caused by the 25' Drainage Easements.

clause_text: Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the 25' Drainage Easements on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the 25' Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners must maintain the drainage easements on their property and cannot make changes to them.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within the Subdivision hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns, and release them from any liability for the placement, construction, design, operation, and maintenance of said Park Area any recreational facility, equipment, dock, or pier, if any, in said Park Area, and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant and Association liable for any issues related to the Park Area and will cover any damages.

clause_text: The Declarant, its successors and assigns, and/or the Association has the right to promulgate rules and regulations governing the use of the Park Area.
plain_summary: The Declarant and Association can create rules for using the Park Area.

clause_text: Owners whose lots are adjacent to or abut the Park Area shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Park Area.
plain_summary: Owners near the Park Area must prevent contamination by not allowing harmful substances to enter the area.

clause_text: Any owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Park Area to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners responsible for contamination must cover cleanup costs and protect the Association from liability.

clause_text: Park Area Easement There is hereby reserved and granted to the Owner of that portion of the Subdivision hereinabove defined as the Park Area along with such Owner's servants, independent contractors, agents, members, guests and invitees (collectively, the 'Park Area Users'), a nonexclusive easement over and across the Subdivision, or portions thereof as provided below, for the following purposes:
plain_summary: The Park Area Owner and their associates have a nonexclusive easement across the Subdivision for specified purposes.

clause_text: Flight of balls {which may i.nclude but not be limited to baseballs, softballs, footballs, tennis balls, soccer balls, volley balls) over, across, and upon the Subdivision;
plain_summary: Balls from various sports may fly over the subdivision.

clause_text: Doing of every act necessary and incident to the playing of recreational activities on or within the Park Area, including, lighting of parking facilities;
plain_summary: Recreational activities and necessary actions, such as lighting parking areas, are allowed in the Park Area.

clause_text: Creation of noise related to the nonnal maintenance, operation and recreational activities of the Park Area, including, but not limited to, the operation of mowing and spraying equipment. Such noise may occur from early morning until late evening.
plain_summary: Noise from maintenance and recreational activities in the Park Area is permitted from early morning until late evening.

citation: Page 5, Damage by Errant Sports Balls
clause_text: Owners of portions of the Subdivision, their successors and assigns, hereby acknowledge and agree that the existence of a Perl: Area within the Subdivision is beneficial and highly desirable; however, each such Owner acknowledges and agrees that portions of the Subdivision located adjacent to, or in close proximity to, the Park = Aie:i. subject to the risk of damage OT injury doe 10 errant sports balls. Owners of ponions of the Subdivision, their successors and assigns, hereby assume the risk of damage and injury and hereby release the owner of the Park Arca, the Association and/or the Declarant, their age111s, employees, officers, suCCCSSOIS and assigns, from any and all liability for damage OT injury caused by errant si>orts balls in, on, or around the Subdivision.
plain_summary: Owners near the Park Area accept the risk of damage from stray sports balls and release the Park's owner and association from liability.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within the Subdivision are advised that there exists Restricted Reserve ''B~, which is ~trictcd to pond/detention area use as shown on the recorded plat of the Subdivision (the "Reserve B"). The Association shall have the obligation to maintain the Detention/Open Space Reserve. Owners hereby agree to bold hannless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and releao;e them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of Reserve B and agree 10 indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain. Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or norm:i.1 operation of Reserve B and Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of Reserve B.
plain_summary: Owners acknowledge the existence of Reserve B, a pond/detention area, and release the Association from liability related to its maintenance and operation.

clause_text: Owners whose Iota are adjacent to or abut Reserve B shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertiliztts, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental h:izards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate Reserve B. Any owner permitting or causing such infiltrdtion shall indemnify and bold bannlcss the Association for all costs ,of clean up and remediation necessary to restore Reserve B to its condition immediately prior to said infilttation.
plain_summary: Owners near Reserve B must prevent contamination and will be responsible for cleanup costs if contamination occurs.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant, the Association and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, operation and/or maintenance of the Drill Site and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant or Association responsible for any issues related to the Drill Site and will cover any damages themselves.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the Drill Site and Owner expressly grants to the Declarant and the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the Drill Site.
plain_summary: Owners accept that there might be disturbances from the Drill Site and allow these disturbances to occur.

clause_text: Owners whose lot abut or are adjacent to the Drill Site shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Drill Site. Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Declarant, the Association and their successors and assigns for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Drill Site to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners near the Drill Site must prevent contamination and will cover cleanup costs if contamination occurs.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant, the Association and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, operation and/or maintenance of the Land and for any activities conducted on the Land, and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant or Association responsible for any issues related to the Land and will cover any damages themselves.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence, normal operation, and/or maintenance of the Land and/or the activities conducted on the Land.
plain_summary: Owners accept that there might be disturbances from the Land and the activities conducted there.

clause_text: Owners whose lots abut the Land shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Land. Any owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Land to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners near the Land must prevent contamination and will cover cleanup costs if contamination occurs.

clause_text: Owners of Lots 8 and 9 in Block I acknowledge and understand that the Association, its Board of Directors, and/or the Declarant, their successors and assigns, are not insurers and that each Owner and occupant of any lot in the Subdivision and each tenant, guest and invitee of any Owner assumes all risks for loss or damage to persons as a result of the a portion of Lots 8 and 9 in Block I being located in the 100 year flood zone.
plain_summary: Owners of Lots 8 and 9 in Block I are responsible for any risks or damages due to their location in a flood zone, and the Association is not liable for such risks.

clause_text: Fencing may be installed on Lots which abut green belts, lakes, ponds, park areas and other landscaping reserves. If fencing is installed on any portion of a Lot which abuts greenbelts, lakes, ponds, park areas and other landscaping reserves, it shall be wrought iron in appearance and shall be in a location and of a material and design as required in this Section and as approved by the ARC.
plain_summary: Fencing on lots adjacent to green spaces must be wrought iron in appearance and approved by the ARC.

clause_text: Gate access from individual Lots is strictly prohibited except on rear Lot lines adjacent to green belts, which rear gates are subject to prior ARC approval.
plain_summary: Gate access from individual lots to green belts is not allowed unless approved by the ARC for rear lot lines.

clause_text: Special Fencing Requirements: Side fencing between any and all Lots, if any is installed, where the rear and/or side of the Lot abuts and/or is contiguous or adjoining to green belts, lakes, ponds, park areas or other landscaping reserves shall be black ornamental iron in appearance, unless otherwise approved by the ARC.
plain_summary: Side fencing near green spaces must be black ornamental iron unless the ARC approves otherwise.

clause_text: Owners shall be responsible for the maintenance, repair and/or replacement of all fences in existence at time of transfer from Builder to Owner. Replacement fences shall be of a similar material and design as originally constructed.
plain_summary: Owners must maintain and replace fences as originally constructed when they take ownership from the builder.

clause_text: The maintenance of any portion of a fence which lies between Lots shall be the joint responsibility of each Lot owner on whose property the fence lies between.
plain_summary: Owners sharing a fence between lots are jointly responsible for its maintenance.

clause_text: In the event an Owner fails to repair, replace or maintain said fence in a manner consistent with the subdivision in the sole discretion of the Board of Directors, the Association shall have the right, but not the obligation, to enter such property for the repair and/or replacement of such fence after notice to the Owner. Any expense incurred by the Association in effectuating such repairs/replacement shall be the responsibility of the Owner and shall be secured by the continuing lien on the Lot.
plain_summary: If an owner does not maintain their fence, the Association can repair it and charge the owner, securing the cost with a lien on the property.

clause_text: The Subdivision shall be held, transferred, sold, conveyed, used and occupied subject to the covenants, restrictions, easements, charges, and liens set forth in the Declaration (the same being herein incorporated by reference for all purposes), and additionally this Supplemental Amendment.
plain_summary: The subdivision must follow the rules and restrictions in the original Declaration and this Supplemental Amendment.

clause_text: In case of conflict between this Supplemental Amendment and the Declaration, this Supplemental Amendment shall control.
plain_summary: If there is a conflict between this amendment and the original Declaration, the terms of this amendment will take precedence.

clause_text: Invalidation of any one or more of the covenants, restrictions conditions or provisions contained in this Supplemental Amendment shall in no wise affect any of the other covenants, restrictions, conditions or provisions which shall remain in full force and effect.
plain_summary: If any part of this amendment is invalidated, the rest will still be enforceable.

clause_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, this Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions and Restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section Three is executed as of the \c..~ day of N~~~blA. 2004.
plain_summary: This section indicates the formal execution of the Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions, and Restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section Three, specifying the date of execution.

clause_text: DECLARANT: MILL CREEK, LT O., a Texas limited partnership By: DEVELOPMENT Texas corporation, its
plain_summary: This clause identifies Mill Creek, Ltd., a Texas limited partnership, as the declarant, represented by a Texas corporation.

clause_text: BEFORE ME, the undersigned authority, on this day personally appeared 0 Q?'ryS·:tl"'r the r:_rLs·,d.LJ of Clear Springs Development Group. L.L.C., a Texas corporation, the General Partner of Mill Creek, Ltd., a Texas limited partnership known by me to be the person whose name is subscribed to the foregoing instrument, and acknowledged to me that slbe executed the same for the purposes and consideration therein expressed and in the capacity therein expressed.
plain_summary: This clause records the acknowledgment by a representative of Clear Springs Development Group, L.L.C., the General Partner of Mill Creek, Ltd., confirming the execution of the document for the stated purposes.

clause_text: GIVEN UNDER MY HAND AND SEAL OF OFFICE, this 11o#. day of Nw t.o-~ 2004.
plain_summary: This clause indicates the date on which the notary public officially witnessed and sealed the document.

clause_text:
LIENHOLDER CONSENT AND SUBORDINATION
----------~ a(n) State Corporation, being the sole beneficiary of a mortgage lien and other liens, assignments and security interests encumbering all or a portion of the Property hereby consents to the terms and provisions of this Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions and Restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section Three to which this Lienholder Consent and Subordination is attached and acknowledges that the execution thereof does not constitute a default under the lien document or any other document executed in connection with or as security for the indebtedness above described, and subordinates the liens of the lien document and any other liens and/or security instruments securing said indebtedness to the rights and interests created under the Declaration, and acknowledges and agrees that a foreclosure of said liens and/or security interests shall not extinguish the rights, obligations and interests created under the Declaration. No warranties of title are hereby made by lienholder, lienholder's joinder herein being solely
plain_summary: A state corporation, as the sole beneficiary of certain liens on the property, agrees to the terms of the amendment to the Declaration of Covenants for Plantation Lakes, Section Three. The corporation consents to subordinate its liens to the rights established under the Declaration and acknowledges that foreclosure of these liens will not affect the rights under the Declaration.

clause_text: THIS SUPPLEMENTAL AMENDMENT TO THE DECLARATION OF COVENANTS, CONDITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS FOR PLANTATION LAKES, SECTION FOUR (the "Supplemental Amendment") is made on the date hereinafter set forth by, Mill Creek, Ltd., hereinafter referred to as "Declarant."
plain_summary: This document is a supplemental amendment to the existing covenants, conditions, and restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section Four, created by Mill Creek, Ltd.

clause_text: WHEREAS, Declarant filed that certain DECLARATION OF COVENANTS, CONDITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS FOR PLANTATION LAKES which is recorded under Clerk's File Number 403932 in the Real Property Records of Waller County, Texas, and under Clerk's File Number 194638 in the Real Property Records of Grimes County, Texas (the "Original Declaration");
plain_summary: The original declaration of covenants for Plantation Lakes was filed and recorded in Waller and Grimes Counties, Texas.

clause_text: WHEREAS, Declarant filed that certain FIRST AMENDMENT TO THE DECLARATION OF COVENANTS, CONDITIONS AND RESTIUCTIONS FOR PLANTATION LAKES, which is recorded under Clerk's File Number 404501 in the Real Property Records of Waller County, Texas, and under Clerk's File Number 194958 in the Real Property Records of Grimes County, Texas (the "First Amendment");
plain_summary: The first amendment to the declaration was filed and recorded in Waller and Grimes Counties, Texas.

clause_text: WHEREAS, Declarant filed that certain SUPPLEMENTAL AMENDMENT TO THE DECLARATION OF COVENANTS, CONDITIONS AND RESTIUCTIONS FOR PLANTATION LAKES, SECTION TWO which is recorded under Clerk's File Number 407183 in the Real Property Records of Waller County, Texas, and under Clerk's File Number 195110 in the Real Property Records of Grimes County, Texas;
plain_summary: A supplemental amendment for Section Two of Plantation Lakes was filed and recorded in Waller and Grimes Counties, Texas.

clause_text: WHEREAS, Declarant filed that certain SUPPLEMENTAL AMENDMENT TO THE DECLARATION OF COVENANTS, CONDITIONS AND RESTIUCTIONS FOR PLANTATION LAKES, SECTION THREE which is recorded under Clerk's File Number 408945 in the Real Property Records of Waller County, Texas, and under Clerk's File Number 195960 in the Real Property Records of Grimes County, Texas;
plain_summary: A supplemental amendment for Section Three of Plantation Lakes was filed and recorded in Waller and Grimes Counties, Texas.

clause_text: WHEREAS, the Original Declaration and the First Amendment are hereinafter collectively referred to as the "Declaration"; and
plain_summary: The original declaration and the first amendment are collectively referred to as the 'Declaration'.

clause_text: WHEREAS, reference is hereby made to the Declaration for all purposes, and any and all capitalized terms used herein shall have the meanings set forth in the Declaration, unless otherwise specified in this Supplemental Amendment;
plain_summary: The document refers to the Declaration for definitions of capitalized terms unless specified otherwise.

clause_text: WHEREAS, pursuant to Article III of the Original Declaration, the Declarant reserved the exclusive and unilateral right to annex any additional property.
plain_summary: The Declarant has the exclusive right to annex additional property as per Article III of the Original Declaration.

clause_text: NOW THEREFORE, pursuant to the powers retained by Declarant as a Class 'B' Member under the Declaration, the Declarant hereby annexes the real property as shown on the map or plat thereof recorded in Volume 1146, Page 94 in the Map or Plat Records of Grimes County, Texas ('Section four') into Plantation Lakes.
plain_summary: The Declarant is annexing Section Four into Plantation Lakes, as recorded in Grimes County, Texas.

clause_text: No Dwelling or other structure shall be erected nearer to any street or property line than that allowed by the applicable plat or other recorded documents, provided that a minimum rear setback equal to twenty-five feet (25') or the rear utility easement as shown on the applicable plat of Section Four, whichever is greater, shall be observed on all Lots; and, provided further that a minimum side setback equal to twenty-five foot (25') or the side utility easement as shown on the applicable plat of Section Four, whichever is greater, shall be observed on all Lots.
plain_summary: Structures must adhere to setback requirements of at least 25 feet or as specified by the plat for Section Four.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four are advised that there exists Restricted Reserve 'A' (hereinafter, the 'Park Area'), which reserve is restricted to park use.
plain_summary: There is a designated Park Area in Section Four that is restricted for park use only.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns, and release them from any liability for the placement, construction, design, operation, use and maintenance of said Park Area, any recreational facility and/or equipment, if any, in said Park Area, and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Lot owners in Section Four agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for any issues related to the Park Area and will indemnify them against damages.

clause_text: Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, lighting, odors, parking and/or traffic which may occur in the normal operation and use of the Park Area or any recreational facility or equipment, if any, in said Park Area.
plain_summary: Lot owners grant an easement allowing for normal operational impacts like noise and traffic related to the Park Area.

clause_text: Owners whose Lots are adjacent to or abut the Park Area shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Park Area.
plain_summary: Lot owners next to the Park Area must prevent contamination by not allowing harmful substances to enter the Park Area.

clause_text: Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Park Area to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners responsible for contaminating the Park Area must cover cleanup costs and indemnify the Association.

clause_text: Park Area Users, a nonexclusive easement over and across Section Four, or portions thereof as provided below, for the following purposes: (i) Flight of balls (which may include but not be limited to baseballs, softballs, footballs, tennis balls, soccer balls, volley balls) over, across, and upon Section Four; (ii) Doing of every act necessary and incident to the playing of recreational activities on or within the Park Area, including, lighting of parking facilities; and (iii) Creation of noise related to the normal maintenance, operation and recreational activities of the Park Area, including, but not limited to, the operation of mowing and spraying equipment. Such noise may occur from early morning until late evening.
plain_summary: Park Area Users have a nonexclusive easement in Section Four for ball flight, recreational activities, and noise from maintenance and operations.

clause_text: Owners of Lots in Section Four, their successors and assigns, hereby acknowledge and agree that the existence of a Park Area within Section Four is beneficial and highly desirable; however, each such Owner acknowledges and agrees that portions Section Four located adjacent to, or in close proximity to, the Park Area are subject to the risk of damage or injury due to errant sports balls. Owners of portions of Section Four, their successors and assigns, hereby assume the risk of damage and injury and hereby release the Owner of the Park Area, the Association and/or the Declarant, their agents, employees, officers, successors and assigns, from any and all liability for damage or injury caused by errant sports balls in, on, or around Section Four.
plain_summary: Lot owners in Section Four accept the risk of damage from errant sports balls and release the Park Area Owner and Association from liability.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four are hereby advised that there exist Reserves B and C within Section Four, which reserves are restricted to equestrian paths, as shown on the recorded plat of Section Four (collectively, the 'Equestrian Paths'). The Association shall not be liable for any injury to or death of a person as a result of (i) such person's use of the Equestrian Paths or (ii) the inherent risk that may be associated with participation in equestrian activities and use of the Equestrian Paths. Further, Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the use of the Equestrian Paths by such Owners, their guests and/or invitees, the existence and/or placement of the Equestrian Paths, and the presence of animals on the Equestrian Paths, and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners acknowledge the existence of Equestrian Paths and release the Association and Declarant from liability for any injuries related to their use.

clause_text: Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the Equestrian Paths or the animals on the Equestrian Paths, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the Equestrian Paths or the animals on the Equestrian Paths.
plain_summary: Owners grant an easement for incidental noise, odors, and traffic related to the Equestrian Paths.

clause_text: Owners hereby acknowledge that the Association, its directors, officers, managers, agents, or employees, the Declarant or any successor Declarant have made no representations or warranties nor has any Owner, occupant, tenant, guest or invitee relied upon any representations or warranties, expressed or implied, relative to any future change in use of the Equestrian Paths. The Declarant, its successors and assigns, and/or the Association has the right to promulgate rules and regulations governing the use of the Equestrian Paths.
plain_summary: Owners acknowledge no warranties have been made regarding future changes to the Equestrian Paths, and the Association can set rules for their use.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four are advised that there exists Reserve 'D', which is designated as a drill site for any oil, gas and mineral development within Section Four ('Reserve D'). Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant, the Association and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, operation and/or maintenance of Reserve D and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners in Section Four acknowledge Reserve D as a drill site and agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for its existence or operation.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of Reserve D and Owners expressly grant to the Declarant and the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of Reserve D.
plain_summary: Owners grant an easement to the Declarant and Association for any incidental disturbances caused by Reserve D.

clause_text: Owners whose Lot abut or are adjacent to Reserve D shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate Reserve D. Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Declarant, the Association and their successors and assigns for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore Reserve D to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners near Reserve D must prevent contamination and will be responsible for cleanup costs if contamination occurs.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four are advised that there exists Reserve E in Section Four, which reserve is restricted to greenbelt purposes, as shown on the recorded plat of Section Four ('Reserve E'). The Association shall have the obligation to maintain Reserve E.
plain_summary: Reserve E is designated for greenbelt purposes, and the Association is responsible for its maintenance.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of Reserve E and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for Reserve E and will indemnify them against damages.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of Reserve E and Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of Reserve E.
plain_summary: Owners grant an easement to the Association for any incidental disturbances caused by Reserve E.

clause_text: Owners whose Lots are adjacent to or abut Reserve E shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate Reserve E. Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore Reserve E to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners near Reserve E must prevent contamination and will be responsible for cleanup costs if contamination occurs.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence and/or placement of the Drainage Easements and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant and Association responsible for any issues related to the Drainage Easements and will protect them from any damages.

clause_text: Owners further grant an easement to the Declarant and the Association for any incidental noise, odors, visibility of the Drainage Easements, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners allow the Declarant and Association to have an easement for any disturbances caused by the Drainage Easements.

clause_text: Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the Drainage Easements on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the Drainage Easements.
plain_summary: Owners must maintain the Drainage Easements on their property and cannot make changes to them.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of the Detention Pond Easement and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant and Association responsible for any issues related to the Detention Pond Easement and will protect them from any damages.

clause_text: Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the Detention Pond Easement.
plain_summary: Owners allow the Association to have an easement for any disturbances caused by the Detention Pond Easement.

clause_text: The Declarant, its successors and assigns, and/or the Association has the right to promulgate rules and regulations governing the use of the Detention Pond Easement.
plain_summary: The Declarant and Association can create rules for using the Detention Pond Easement.

clause_text: Owners whose Lots are adjacent to or abut the Detention Pond Easement shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Detention Pond Easement.
plain_summary: Owners near the Detention Pond Easement must prevent contamination by not allowing harmful substances to enter.

clause_text: Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Detention Pond Easement to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners responsible for contamination must cover cleanup costs and protect the Association from related expenses.

clause_text: Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the Detention Pond Easement.
plain_summary: Owners cannot make changes to the Detention Pond Easement.

clause_text: Owners of Lots 4, 5, 6, 38, and 39 in Block 11 acknowledge and understand that the Association, its Board of Directors, and/or the Declarant, their successors and assigns, are not insurers and that each Owner and occupant of any Lot in Section Four and each tenant, guest and invitee of any Owner assumes all risks for loss or damage to persons as a result of the a portion of Lots 4, 5, 6, 38, and 39 in Block II being located in the 100 year flood zone.
plain_summary: Owners of specific lots in Block 11 acknowledge that they assume all risks for damage due to their location in a flood zone, and the Association is not responsible for insuring against such risks.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of the Creeks and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for any issues related to the Creeks and will indemnify them against any damages.

clause_text: Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence of the Creeks.
plain_summary: Owners grant the Association an easement for any incidental disturbances caused by the Creeks.

clause_text: The Declarant, its successors and assigns, and/or the Association has the right to promulgate rules and regulations governing the use of the Creeks.
plain_summary: The Declarant and Association have the authority to establish rules for the use of the Creeks.

clause_text: Owners on whose Lots adjoin the Creeks are located shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Creeks.
plain_summary: Owners with lots next to the Creeks must prevent pollution and maintain the cleanliness of the Creeks.

clause_text: Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Creeks to their condition immediately prior to said infiltration.
plain_summary: Owners responsible for polluting the Creeks must cover cleanup costs and protect the Association from liability.

clause_text: Owners of Lots within Section Four are advised that running through a portion of Section Four there exists a Houston Lighting & Power Company one hundred eighty foot (180') easement, more particularly described in Volume 251, Page 573 in the Grimes County Deed Records (the 'HL&P Easement').
plain_summary: There is a 180-foot easement for Houston Lighting & Power Company within Section Four.

clause_text: Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of the HL&P Easement and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Owners agree not to hold the Declarant or Association liable for issues related to the HL&P Easement and will indemnify them against any damages.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the HL&P Easement and Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the HL&P Easement.
plain_summary: Owners grant the Association an easement for any incidental disturbances caused by the HL&P Easement.

clause_text: Owners whose on whose Lots the HL&P Easement is located shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the HL&P Easement. Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the HL&P Easement to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration. Each Owner shall have the obligation of maintaining the portion of the HL&P Easement on such Owner's Lot. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the HL&P Easement.
plain_summary: Owners must not allow any harmful substances to enter the HL&P Easement and must maintain it. They cannot change its natural state or install improvements. If they cause any damage, they must cover the cleanup costs.

clause_text: Owners of Lot 2, Block I and Lots 36 and 37, Block 11, within Section Four are advised that there exists a twenty foot (20') access easement along the northern perimeter of Lot 2, Block I and a twenty foot (20') access easement along the southern Lot line of Lot 36, Block II and the northern Lot line of 37, Block II (ten feet on each Lot), as shown on the recorded plat of Section Four (collectively, the 'Access Easements'). The Association shall have the obligation to maintain the Access Easements. Owners hereby agree to hold harmless the Declarant and the Association, and their successors and assigns and release them from any liability for the existence, placement, and/or maintenance of the Access Easements and agree to indemnify the parties released from any damages they may sustain.
plain_summary: Certain lots have a 20-foot access easement. The Association will maintain these easements, and owners cannot hold the Declarant or Association liable for any issues related to them.

clause_text: Owners acknowledge that there may be incidental noise, lighting, odors, and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the Access Easements and Owners expressly grant to the Association, an easement for incidental noise, lighting, odors and/or traffic which may occur due to the existence and/or normal operation of the Access Easements.
plain_summary: Owners accept that the Access Easements may cause noise, lighting, odors, and traffic, and they grant the Association an easement for these occurrences.

clause_text: Owners whose Lots are adjacent to or abut the Access Easements shall take care and shall not permit any trash, fertilizers, chemicals, petroleum products, environmental hazards or any other foreign matters to infiltrate the Access Easements. Any Owner permitting or causing such infiltration shall indemnify and hold harmless the Association for all costs of clean up and remediation necessary to restore the Access Easements to its condition immediately prior to said infiltration. Owners may not obstruct, fill, alter the natural slope of, alter the topography of, or install any improvements on the Access Easements.
plain_summary: Owners next to Access Easements must prevent harmful substances from entering and cannot alter the easements. They must pay for any necessary cleanup if they cause damage.

clause_text: Fencing may be installed on Lots which abut green belts, lakes, ponds, park areas and other landscaping reserves, subject to prior ARC approval. If fencing is installed on any portion of a Lot which abuts greenbelts, lakes, ponds, park areas and other landscaping reserves, it shall be wrought iron in appearance and shall be in a location and of a material and design as required.
plain_summary: Owners can install fencing on lots next to green spaces, but it must be approved by the ARC and be wrought iron in appearance.

clause_text: Gate access from individual Lots is strictly prohibited except on rear Lot lines adjacent to green belts, which rear gates, if installed, are subject to prior ARC approval.
plain_summary: Homeowners cannot have gate access from their lots to green belts unless it's on the rear lot line and approved by the ARC.

clause_text: Special Fencing Requirements: Side fencing between any and all Lots, if any is installed, where the rear and/or side of the Lot abuts and/or is contiguous or adjoining to green belts, lakes, ponds, park areas or other landscaping reserves shall be black ornamental iron in appearance, unless otherwise approved, in writing, by the ARC.
plain_summary: Fences next to green belts or similar areas must be black ornamental iron unless the ARC approves something else in writing.

clause_text: All such fencing, if installed, shall not exceed four feet (4') in height and must conform to all ARC requirements.
plain_summary: Fences must not be taller than four feet and must meet ARC standards.

clause_text: Owners shall be responsible for the maintenance, repair and/or replacement of all fences in existence at time of transfer from Builder to Owner.
plain_summary: Homeowners must maintain, repair, or replace fences that were there when they bought the property.

clause_text: The maintenance of any portion of a fence which lies between Lots shall be the joint responsibility of each Lot Owner on whose property the fence lies between.
plain_summary: If a fence is between two lots, both homeowners are responsible for its maintenance.

clause_text: In the event an Owner fails to repair, replace or maintain said fence in a manner consistent with the Subdivision in the sole discretion of the Board of Directors, the Association shall have the right, but not the obligation, to enter such Lot for the repair and/or replacement of such fence after notice to the Owner.
plain_summary: If a homeowner doesn't maintain their fence properly, the Association can fix it after notifying the owner.

clause_text: Any expense incurred by the Association in effectuating such repairs/replacement shall be the responsibility of the Owner and shall be secured by the continuing lien on the Lot.
plain_summary: If the Association repairs a fence, the homeowner must pay for it, and the cost will be a lien on their property.

clause_text: Section Four shall be held, transferred, sold, conveyed, used and occupied subject to the covenants, restrictions, easements, charges, and liens set forth in the Declaration (the same being herein incorporated by reference for all purposes), and additionally this Supplemental Amendment.
plain_summary: Section Four is subject to all rules and restrictions in the Declaration and this Supplemental Amendment.

clause_text: In case of conflict between this Supplemental Amendment and the Declaration, this Supplemental Amendment shall control.
plain_summary: If there's a conflict between this amendment and the original Declaration, this amendment takes precedence.

clause_text: Invalidation of any one or more of the covenants, restrictions conditions or provisions contained in this Supplemental Amendment shall in no wise affect any of the other covenants, restrictions, conditions or provisions which shall remain in full force and effect.
plain_summary: If any part of this amendment is invalidated, the rest still applies.

clause_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, this Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions and Restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section four is executed as of the 15f day of f(OUCfl<.W , 2005.
plain_summary: This section states the execution date of the Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions, and Restrictions for Plantation Lakes, Section Four.

clause_text: DECLARANT: MILL CREEK, LTD., a Texas limited partnership By: CLEAR DEVELOPMENT GRO .C. a exas corporation, its gen I partn By:_~e!t==:::~--- Print Name: -+----\--==;:..c"'-=--"-"-'-"---- Print Title: -~--+-.2.1..='-""><.!,.-----
plain_summary: This section identifies Mill Creek, Ltd. as the declarant, represented by Clear Development Group, a Texas corporation, as its general partner.

clause_text: STA TE OF TEXAS § § COUNTY OF fl1tJ1t.f6yJ~ BEFORE ME, the undersigned authority, on this day personally appeared Ua4 Sujloi., , the />,u__71tfuu- of Clear Springs Development Group, L.L.C., a Texas corporation, the General Partner of Mill Creek, Ltd., a Texas limited partnership known by me to be the person whose name is subscribed to the foregoing instrument, and acknowledged to me that s/he executed the same for the purposes and consideration therein expressed and in the capacity therein expressed.
plain_summary: This section is a notary acknowledgment confirming that a representative of Clear Springs Development Group, the general partner of Mill Creek, Ltd., appeared before the notary to execute the document.

clause_text: G!VEN UNDER MY HAND AND SEAL OF OFFICE, this j$t' day of Nov~ 2005. Notary Public - State of Texas
plain_summary: This section indicates the date and official seal of the notary public who witnessed the signing of the document.

clause_text:
LIENHOLDER CONSENT AND SUBORDINATION
/Jr;;,f bMf:- of Cu11tOG, tJd. a(n) /e:l!'?t s State _ Corporation.
being the sole beneficiary of a mortgage lien and other liens, assignments and ecurity interests
encumbering all or a portion of the Property hereby consents to the tenns and provisions of this
Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants, Conditions and Restrictions for
Plantation Lakes, Section Four to which this Lienholder Consent and Subordination is attached
and acknowledges that the execution thereof does not constitute a default under the lien
document or any other document executed in connection with or as security for the indebtedness
above described, and subordinates the liens of the lien document and any other liens and/or
security instruments securing said indebtedness to the rights and interests created under the
Declaration, and acknowledges and agrees that a foreclosure of said liens and/or security
interests shall not extinguish the rights, obligations and interests created under the Declaration.
No warranties of title are hereby made by lienholder, lienholder's joinder herein being solely
limited to such consent and subordination.
plain_summary: The lienholder, identified as a state corporation, consents to the terms of the Supplemental Amendment to the Declaration of Covenants for Plantation Lakes, Section Four. The lienholder agrees that this consent does not constitute a default under any lien documents and subordinates its liens to the rights and interests created under the Declaration. It also agrees that foreclosure of the liens will not extinguish the rights and obligations under the Declaration.
